All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
ActionObserver
Inteface for Action Observers, used to notify the sound engine to play a sound.
BeginScreen
Screen to select level and the way you want to control the player and the level.
ButtonsPanel
Panel for the GameScreen that contains the control Buttons.
ConsoleView
ConsoleView-Strategy is used to print the Game State to the console.
Controller
Controller is used to control every class.
ControlSavePanel
Panel for the GameScreen containing a button to change control input and a save game state button.
Crate
Crate is a class that extends Box.
Creater
This class is made for creating boards and writing them to a file so we can load in levels easily.
GameBoard
game board is the main class of the game holding the board.
GameboardObserver
Interface for Gameboard Observers
GameBoardPanel
gameBoard uses a gridbagLayout to show the user the situation of the board via the GUI.
GameBoardScreen
This holds the GameBoardPanel and the OptionsPanel and packs them into a frame to show it to the user.
GuiView
Implementation of a Viewing strategy.
InvalidTileConfigException
Exception for Tile Class when the tile is configured in a faulty way.
LevelSelector
This panel represents a grid of the levels you are able to select.
MoveDirection
Enum for specifying the possible player Move directions
MoveType
Enum for possible actions the user can input into the program.
OptionsPanel
Is the Options Panel on the top of the GameScreen, it contains buttons for conrolling view, changing the Control Input option, an option for saving/loading the gamestate and a button to return to the begin screen.
PanelListener
Panel listener interface is used to communicate from a sub class to a parent class in an uncoupled manner.
SoundController
SoundController for the Game Under certain Conditions/ if the user inputs certain commands (like move player) the sound controller will be invoked per ObserverPattern and play a sound.
StartUp
This is the class that initiates the whole application.
Tile
The Tiles of which the gameboard consists of.
Tuple<T>
Utility class for Storing immutable data pairs
